reviews.review_msg: Prof. Ramnarine was one of the best professors I've had at SFU. His thorough and direct teaching style was easy to understand. The material covered in class aligned very closely with the midterm and final exam. However, the class wasn't a breeze, you have to do a lot of reading from the textbooks to fully understand the material.

Sasha had great lectures and was very informative + well versed in this field. Examples and explanations were clear. Layout of instructions for the group projects was good, though be careful as you will be randomized in groups. Inquiries regarding assignments and exams were sometimes not answered straight-fowardly though.

Really top notch professor, I really enjoyed the way that he lectures and his organization was really great. Would totally recommend, I wish he taught more courses honestly. Thank you so much Sasha! Sidenote, I will say specifically for this class, try to avoid the TA Ekam Kochhar as she is an very overly tough marker.

One of my favourite teachers.
-Records lectures
-Engaging lectures
-Very knowledgeable about the course material and beyond(is a lawyer)
-Cares for the students
-Gives fair tests
-Gives practice exams 
-You don't need to read the textbook(s) and instead study slides/recordings and practice exams
-Only a midterm, take-home final, one group project

Such an amazing professor! Mr. Ramnarine truly cares about the course that he teaches and inspires you to take initiative and do well in the course. Absolutely recommend him as he is one of the best profs you could ask for in SFU.

There are textbooks although you don't need them much. 
Take notes and study lecture material because that is what you are tested on. 

Professor himself is very nice and engaging.

Lectures are recorded so you could stay home if you want to

He is an illustration of what a professor should be. Very articulated and cares about teaching. He separates the class into two sections: Law (45%) Ethics (35%). Law is harder but it's not a tough course. If you can write then you are in a good position. I really enjoyed his lectures and the content is applicable to everyday life.

He was a really good prof. Listen to his lectures and you will do well. His exam questions may look easy but to do well you will need to put in a lot of detail. The questions will also be similar to what he says in the lecture, my tip would be to answer the questions in a similar way as he does in his lectures.

Sasha ramnarine changed my perspective on how teachers should be teaching. Most teachers just seem to teach for the money but Sasha teaches because he loves the topic and definitely has a passion for teaching others. If I do badly in this class, I know that its because I didn't study enough. favourite teacher of all time, no doubt about it.
Out of all the professors I've had during my four years at SFU I can safely say that Sasha is the best.

Hes such a good prof that when i did poorly on the exam, I actually blamed myself. Very compelling and in depth, makes what seems like a stale topic into a fascinating one. Don't be like me and miss the first 3 classes thinking it was just an ordinary course. It really is much more than that
much depth and great examples. Such a pure warm-hearted human being! One of my best Profs ever!

Honestly he is a great professor. He is respectful and he cares about his students. Very good at teaching, communicating with his students, answers all questions with full in depth answers making sure you understand before he moves on. This man will go above and beyond to help the students understand, pass, and relate to the concepts taught in sooo

He managed to make law interesting and clear, which I didn't think was possible. He made the lectures interesting and used relevant examples to clarify complex topics. Would definitely take another class with him!

HANDS DOWN one of the best profs I've had in my 5 years at SFU. Super passionate about the content, treats you like a human being, tests are fair, and any extra help you need is there for you the second you ask. Doesn't just read from slides, translates it into connectable content. Wish every prof at SFU was like this. A+++++!
Excellent!!
Great professor and very knowledgeable in the subject matter. Fair exams that are a bit tough but fair.
A real one!!! Wants the best for students

Super funny guy that makes lectures interesting!! He can turn boring topics more relatable and keeps the class engaged through discussion. I recommend attending lectures as the examples mentioned in class are on the midterm. Average was quite low but if you attend classes and read the textbook you'll be way above. He's reliable and offers help.

Dr. Pflanz was my first BUS prof, and I genuinely enjoyed his class over the summer so much that I took another course with him this fall! His tests were quite intense, but he's super sweet if you get to know him, lowk funny and his experience as a lawyer makes him a great resource for those aspiring. Very sociable and gives really good feedback

I really enjoyed BUS233 with Professor Pflanz. His business law content is detailed and informative, the exam is fair and covers strictly what he went over in class. It is definitely a course where you need to put the time in, and memorize material in order to succeed. His legal background makes it cool. Law half was better than ethics.

This was one of my favourite prof at SFU. For a first law class I really enjoyed his course structure. Slides are based on textbook and the course is very organized. Be prepared for a lot of memorization so I recommend to understand concept and also some active recall. His lectures are clear and concise, and we can see that his passionate!
he's great and knows my name

James is one of the best profs ive gotten in SFU. He really cares about his students and tries to make his lectures as interesting as possible. Although attendance is mandatory as his tests includes things he talks about in lectures. His tests are quite hard and they are curved, but if you understand how to answer the question, its going to be easy

He is a very knowledgeable man and his lectures contain a lot of good information. He knows what he is talking about but he is rude and does not know how to handle feedback. He has told multiple people that they would not succeed and should drop his class due to being a major outside of business and has laughed in students' faces.

He is a great lecturer and really helps you to understand the concepts in the course. Lots of reading, and you are going to have to do the readings and ensure you really understand the concepts if you want to do well in his class. Also, very tough grader. Man doesn't just give out an A. Do not take if you're just looking for an easy GPA booster
Engaging lectures and useful guidance from the prof. For study prep, ChatGPT and unstuckstudy ai were super helpful alongside the free course materials. Overall, a rewarding experience.

Loved the content of the class, and the mark I got was not bad. the issue here is the prof. extremely rude, ill mannered, and finds joy out of embarrassing his students. he should have some shame. dont ever book a phone call w him- he will use that time to degrade you

Super engaging and funny lectures. For the law assignment, he gives you a sample you can follow. For the ethics exam, he guides you on how to approach the questions that will be on the final. He also posts slides and lecture recordings. However, think before asking him for help. He doesn't like it if you email him late at night.
He is super amazing. He is the best prof I have had at SFU sp far, and I would love to take his class in the future.

Amazing professor, hands down one of the best professors at SFU. He is caring and engaging, I actually learnt stuff in his class as opposed to other profs who might have a very qualified degree but know nothing in their discipline.

I found the prof very engaging and extremely knowledgeable. I am not sure about the student in the review below but I found him very respectful and fair and very approachable. In fact he was my best prof last year. I thought the marking was very fair too. I am actually taking his other course this semester and so far very consistent

Easily the best prof I've ever had. Despite long lectures, it was super easy to engage and understand topics with him using unique stories and examples. He also had practical real-world experiences and stories which was super cool to hear. Studying for the midterm was relatively easy because of this although it is somewhat tricky but rewarding.
Best professor I've had so far. Attend lectures and you'll understand why. 10/10 would recommend.

I would highly recommend Shafik. He has clear grading criteria, encourages participation, and makes lectures interesting. His midterm exam is extremely fair, and if you miss a lecture he provides lecture recordings on canvas. The papers are pretty easy and there isn't much work you have to do outside of class.

As a non-business major this has been my favourite class I have ever taken in my 3 years at SFU. Shafik is a rare prof. who is a combination of humour, genuinely has care for his students, and thoroughly teaches content with clarity. He is the most fair prof. I've had and if you ever get a chance to take a class with him, you'll forever cherish it.

It felt really good to know how much he cares about his students. One of the best Professors I've had at SFU! he's also very interesting and tries his best to answer all your questions. There aren't a lot of thing to do (3- midterm, assignment, final) all worth 30% so you'll need to do well on all to get a good mark but its most definitely doable

One of the best profs i met ! Very genuine, really helpful and his classes are very interesting and interactive! He mostly gives real life examples which would really really help any student to understand the concepts better! Really fair with marking!
Funny guy and genuinely a good prof. Definitely recommend.
Shafik Bhalloo is a very caring prof and loves what he teaches. He provides loads of his own time if you choose to contact him. being available during most week days as well as some weekends.
Very good teacher! Would take any class with him again for sure. I had him for bus 233 and he was extremely understanding and good!

Shafik Bhalla was one of the best profs I had. His lectures are worth attending, and they are not boring at all. His style of teaching is very good and the main thing. When you write him an email about anything and if you mention your cell number, this guy CALLS YOU back within 2 hours. His exams are not that difficult tbh.

Shafik is excellent at explaining concepts in a clear and concise manner, as well as keeping lectures engaging. He is very clear when it comes to his expectations, so as long as you put an effort in you will end up with a good grade. He is dedicated and a good example of what students wish all profs could be like.

Shafik is one of my all-time favourite profs at SFU. He is super understanding, and accommodates his teaching style for the benefit of his students, especially in online school. He is accessible outside of class time and will make sure topics are completely understood. Lectures are fun, participation helps, and you won't even want to skip class!

Shafik has easily become one of my top favourite instructors on my 2 years in SFU. Hes kind , hilarious and truly I MEAN TRULY cares for his students. Hes passionate about his work and it shows in class. by the writing of this I have not received my grade, so this is my unbiased opinion . If youre even slightly interested in bus law I recomd it
Great adaptation for the online style. Great care for the students. Great life stories.

Shafik is a very engaging prof. who keeps lectures interesting by telling stories related to course material. Course content is quite easy, work load is light, and you can get by just using lecture notes. Attendance is not mandatory but highly recommended as his lectures really help you to understand the material. Great prof. highly recommend.

Shafik is awesome! He cares so much about his students and is super accessible. Half the course is based on law, which I think he did a better job of teaching - made it super interesting by bringing in real world examples. The ethics part was bearable. Fair exams. Would love to take a class with him again!

Shafik is the best prof I've ever had. Sometimes he rambled on a bit long about some subjects, but overall was a great lecturer, very knowledgable with funny stories. If you show up to class you do not need to read the textbooks, he provides detailed notes. Some of the MC on Midterm were identical to Qs on the practice exam he gives.

as a practicing lawyer, he brings a lot of knowledge and passion to each class with relevant and current examples. great discussions and participation was encouraged. he was always available even when he was working from the law firm and sometimes even on weekends. First semester this course was offered, course load was light - highly recommend

Exam is tomorrow. He was available to take my question on Sunday and call me back. Thisbis service. I find lectures so unteresting. He is definitely very clear and makes materials very interesting. I never skip his classes. He is also very fair based on midterm. He wants you to do very well and will help you if you want to work hard. Great teacher.

He was a really great and straight forward professor. He clearly outlined what would be on midterm and final. He gave a practice midterm and some of the same questions were on his actual midterm! However, he talks way too much and the class became such a drag at times. I never showed up to lecture, because he did send out slides!

I took Shafiks bus233 class in Business Law and ethics. I Really enjoyed his class. He made the subject very interesting. I like his style. Many excellent examples and very clear. I have decided to take a minor in business because of this class. I think he is very caring and really excellent prof.
